question: I am a 37 year old white female.  I had a baby almost 6 months ago (July 2010).  During my pregnancy I felt fine (I do have chronic hypertension which was well treated during my second pregnancy, although I did have preeclampsia with my first in Set 2008).  About 2 months after my son was born I started feeling "not right".  Muscle cramps, what felt like bone pain, back pain, fatigue, stomach aches, daily headaches. I thought it was just the stresses of having a newborn and a 2 year old but I decided to go to my doctor.  She ran several labs and my liver enzymes came back elevated - twice as high as they should be.  During my pregnancy they were lower and normal.  Since then, I have had a barrage of lab tests - all normal but the abnormal LFT's and elevated ANA. a liver biopsy was ordered due to the ANA being elevated and that only showed "mildly dilated sinusoids".  My GE doc ordered an echocardiogram looking for portal hypertension but it was normal.  I have had a normal US, MRCP, abdominal CT scan with contrast and venogram.  I have had a lupus scare in the past but my nephrologist (who is treating me for the hypertension) did a renal lupus blood test and "no news is good news".  I have also been diagnosied with sjogren's syndrome in the past but the things it can cause to the liver was ruled out with the biopsy (so my GE doc said).  I have seemed to have gotten a little better but my enzymes were still twice the normal limit in December (it had gone to TRIPLE in October).  I still have extreme fatigue (my baby has been sleeping through the night since 3 mos of age so that isn't it) and stomach discomfort.What I am wondering is what other tests could possibly be ordered, if any?  Is there something I just haven't been screened for?  This is frustrating me and with 2 small boys - the oldest only 2, I want to get this resolved and treated if it needs to be!
title: Liver issues
